titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Washington Lemeul Atlee (1808-1878) received his M.D. from Jefferson Medical College in 1829. He was professor of medical chemistry at the University of Pennsylvania and held this post from 1844 to 1852. He was president of the Pennsylvania Medical Society and vice-president of the American Medical Association. He was a founder of the American Gynecological Society. His most important work was General and Differential Diagnosis of Ovarian Tumors with Specific Reference to the Operation of Ovariotomy, published in 1872.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains letters written to Atlee from David Patterson, Esq., Edward Wayne, Annie Woodburn, and George W. Woodburn. The letters relate to medical conditions and treatments as well as legal and personal matters.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
